2.08.text:
Testament Of Youth is a true coming-of-age
story set around the First World War and is

6.43.text:
based on the classic memoir of British writer
Vera Brittain.

10.06.text:
The story starts in 1914, shortly before the
war, and follows the young and spirited Vera

14.85.text:
through days spent with her loving brother
and friends, a burgeoning love affair, and

18.73.text:
her determination to study at Oxford, against
her parents’ wishes.

22.57.text:
But when fighting begins, her own life and
the lives of her loved ones are turned upside

28.18.text:
Testament Of Youth is Swedish actress Alicia
Vikander’s first lead role in an English-language

33.92.text:
film, not that you’d ever dream that given
her strikingly self-assured performance.

38.94.text:
Of course, she’s already done a number of
films in English before this, shining in supporting

42.80.text:
roles in Joe Wright’s Anna Karenina and
alongside Benedict Cumberbatch in WikiLeaks

48.22.text:
There’s no doubt that Testament Of Youth
is Vikander’s breakthrough film though and

53.01.text: she is utterly captivating in it.

55.50.text:
Her portrayal of Vera is completely without
artifice.

58.54.text:
She portrays her fierce intelligence, her
stubbornness, her humanity and much more to

64.66.text:
You truly believe her as Vera whatever she’s
doing.

67.91.text:
Not only is Vikander capable of a finely nuanced
performance, she is also one of those rare

74.03.text:
actors who have the ability to say so much
with barely a look or a flicker of emotion

80.54.text:
By the way, you can also see Vikander in lots
of other films this year including the outstanding

85.77.text:
sci-fi flick Ex Machina – which I’ll be
uploading a review of shortly – and opposite

90.22.text:
Superman himself Henry Cavill in the spy-action-comedy
The Man From U.N.C.L.E.

95.29.text:
And if you want to find out more about the
year ahead for Vikander, click here to watch

99.31.text:
my video on the 10 Actors You Must Watch in
2015!

103.64.text:
Vikander is joined by a strong supporting
cast who each give subtle, impeccable turns.

111.06.text:
Watch out for Game Of Thrones star Kit Harington
as Vera’s poetry-writing suitor, Merlin

116.82.text:
star Colin Morgan as a friend who’s in unrequited
love with her, Kingsman: The Secret Service

121.76.text:
star Taron Egerton as her devoted brother,
Broadchurch star Jonathan Bailey as her brother’s

126.50.text:
friend, Dominic West and Emily Watson as her
parents, and Miranda Richardson as her Oxford

132.47.text:
Testament Of Youth is TV director James Kent’s
first feature film.

136.39.text:
And what a wonderfully restrained and delicate
debut it is too.

140.56.text:
Kent lovingly depicts so many small details
that really stuck in my memory.

145.04.text:
There’s the humorous montage of Vera and
her boyfriend stealing little moments together

149.80.text:
at cinemas and art galleries while they’re
followed by a chaperone.

153.09.text:
There’s Vera frantically thumbing through
the streams of ‘Fallen In Combat’ pages

158.18.text:
in the newspaper – pages and pages of tiny
type with hundreds of names printed on broadsheet-sized

165.00.text:
There’s the close-up of Vera’s face, the
sound of her breathing, and the ticking of

168.50.text: a clock as she receives a phone call.

170.61.text:
There are close-ups of rain hammering the
trenches, of a piece of barbed wire, and of

174.73.text: mud dripping down a trench wall.

176.65.text:
Images which are both beautifully simple and
powerfully stark, and will likely leave you

181.04.text:
with a tear in your eye and a lump in your
throat.

183.97.text:
The film’s behind-the-scenes team all do
an absolutely top-notch job including writer

189.01.text:
Juliette Towhidi, and cinematographer Rob
Hardy, whose work you’ll see again this

194.59.text:
Hardy captures skilfully the contrast between
life before and during the war.

198.95.text:
Oh, and do look out for a poignant Gone With
The Wind-inspired scene at a hospital too.

203.17.text:
The work of costume and production designers
Consolata Boyle and Jon Henson not only adds

207.93.text:
to the film’s authenticity but lends it
an incredible richness.

211.58.text:
And composer Max Richter provides a suitably
moving score.

214.95.text:
But I also love the fact that occasionally
the film forgoes music and is left to breathe

219.32.text:
with just ambient sound revealing all we need
to know or feel.

222.85.text:
To sum up: Testament Of Youth is a triumph
of restrained and lyrical cinema with a superlative

230.06.text:
With the centenary of the First World War
last year, the film offers a haunting and

234.18.text:
fitting tribute to those who lost their lives
and those they left behind.

238.36.text: Testament Of Youth gets 4 out of 5 Flicks.

241.32.text: What did you think of Testament Of Youth?

243.88.text: And what’s your favourite big-screen adaptation?

246.62.text: How about your favourite war-time drama?

249.16.text: Let me know in the comments below!

251.21.text:
If you like this video, hit the thumbs-up
button & subscribe for my weekly movie reviews

256.17.text: Thanks for watching and see ya next time.
